result.execSummary:
The defendant Justine Nicole Radaj was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Alter Price (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(a).
  • Intent. Contribute/Delinquency Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.40(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If defendant is in compliance with Probation and pays restitution early, defendant may discharge after 1 year.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations. 
Comply with mental health treatment and medications as prescribed, and follow any treatment recommendations. Cannot stop treatment without approval of Agent or health care provider.

Bond Terminated Slip
c: WC Jail

Defendant Justine Nicole Radaj in court.  Attorney Danuta Kurczewski in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Alex Gelhar in court for Justine Nicole Radaj. 
Plea questionnaire filed with the court.
Court amends Ct. 1 to a Misdm. Retail Theft 943.50(1m)(a)
Def. plea to Amnd. Ct. 1 NC; Def. plea to Ct. 2 NC
Rights given.
Court finds def. waiving rights, finds basis and will find def. guilty Amnd. Ct. 1 and Ct. 2
State in compliance with victim notification.
Stmts Counsel regarding sentencing.
Stmt. by Defendant.
Court withholds sentence places def. on probation; Ct. 2 -1 yr. probation; Ct. 1 - 2 yrs. probation if defendant is in compliance with Probation and pays restitution early discharge after 1 year.  Conditions of probation pay restitution surcharge $27.30; Pay restitution $272.95 to Fleet Farm, Pay the costs of the action including supervision fees.
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.  Comply with mental health treatment and medications as prescribed and follow any treatment recommendations cannot stop treatment without approval of Agent or health care provider.  
Def. given Post Conviction.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 2, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Status conference on May 31, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Status conference on March 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Danuta Kurczewski, ADA present.
Attorney Alex Gelhar present.
Defendant present.
Information received, reading waived.
Defendant stands mute. 
Court enters not guilty plea on behalf of Defendant. 
STC 3/25/22 at 10:00 am
Request for Restitution / Waupaca County Restitution Summary

Defendant appeared in Court.  Atty Gelhar present. 
Assistant District Attorney Nicholas Bolz: Present 
Complaint received, reading waived. 
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.
Defendant questioned by the Court and advised of rights.
Court finds defendant waiving right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Court finds probable cause and binds over to B3 for trial. 
Information to be filed mirroring the complaint. 
Reading waived. 
Bond recommendations by counsel. 
$2000 signature bond set - See bond for conditions.
